trans-unit.source: How to Manage Expiration of Blob Content in the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN)
trans-unit.target: How to Manage Expiration of Blob Content in the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN)

trans-unit.source: How to Manage Expiration of Blob Content in the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN)
trans-unit.target: How to Manage Expiration of Blob Content in the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN)

trans-unit.source: Blobs that benefit the most from Azure CDN caching are those that are accessed frequently during their time-to-live (TTL) period.
trans-unit.target: Blobs that benefit the most from Azure CDN caching are those that are accessed frequently during their time-to-live (TTL) period.

trans-unit.source: A blob stays in the cache for the TTL period and then is refreshed by the blob service after that time is elapsed.
trans-unit.target: A blob stays in the cache for the TTL period and then is refreshed by the blob service after that time is elapsed.

trans-unit.source: Then the process repeats.
trans-unit.target: Then the process repeats.

trans-unit.source: You have two options for controlling the TTL.
trans-unit.target: You have two options for controlling the TTL.

trans-unit.source: Do not set cache values thus using the default TTL of 7 days.
trans-unit.target: Do not set cache values thus using the default TTL of 7 days.

trans-unit.source: Explicitly set the *x-ms-blob-cache-control* property on a **Put Blob**, **Put Block List**, or **Set Blob Properties** request, or use the Azure Managed Library to set the [BlobProperties.CacheControl](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.storage.blob.blobproperties.cachecontrol.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: Explicitly set the *x-ms-blob-cache-control* property on a **Put Blob**, **Put Block List**, or **Set Blob Properties** request, or use the Azure Managed Library to set the [BlobProperties.CacheControl](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.storage.blob.blobproperties.cachecontrol.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: Setting this property sets the value of the *Cache-Control* header for the blob.
trans-unit.target: Setting this property sets the value of the *Cache-Control* header for the blob.

trans-unit.source: The value of the header or property should specify the appropriate value in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The value of the header or property should specify the appropriate value in seconds.

trans-unit.source: For example, to set the maximum caching period to one year, you can specify the request header as `x-ms-blob-cache-control: public, max-age=31556926`.
trans-unit.target: For example, to set the maximum caching period to one year, you can specify the request header as `x-ms-blob-cache-control: public, max-age=31556926`.

trans-unit.source: For details on setting caching headers, see the [HTTP/1.1 specification](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html).
trans-unit.target: For details on setting caching headers, see the [HTTP/1.1 specification](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html).

trans-unit.source: Any content that you wish to cache via the CDN must be stored in your Azure storage account as a publicly accessible blob.
trans-unit.target: Any content that you wish to cache via the CDN must be stored in your Azure storage account as a publicly accessible blob.

trans-unit.source: For more details on the Azure Blob service, see **Blob Service Concepts**.
trans-unit.target: For more details on the Azure Blob service, see **Blob Service Concepts**.

trans-unit.source: There are a few different ways that you can work with content in the Blob service:
trans-unit.target: There are a few different ways that you can work with content in the Blob service:

trans-unit.source: By using the managed API provided by the **Azure Managed Library Reference**.
trans-unit.target: By using the managed API provided by the **Azure Managed Library Reference**.

trans-unit.source: By using a third-party storage management tool.
trans-unit.target: By using a third-party storage management tool.

trans-unit.source: By using the Azure Storage Services REST API.
trans-unit.target: By using the Azure Storage Services REST API.

trans-unit.source: The following code example is a console application that uses the Azure Managed Library to create a container, set its permissions for public access, and create a blob within the container.
trans-unit.target: The following code example is a console application that uses the Azure Managed Library to create a container, set its permissions for public access, and create a blob within the container.

trans-unit.source: It also explicitly specifies a desired refresh interval by setting the Cache-Control header on the blob.
trans-unit.target: It also explicitly specifies a desired refresh interval by setting the Cache-Control header on the blob.

trans-unit.source: Assuming you have enabled the CDN as shown above, the blob that is created will be cached by the CDN.
trans-unit.target: Assuming you have enabled the CDN as shown above, the blob that is created will be cached by the CDN.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to specify your account credentials using your own storage account and access key:
trans-unit.target: Be sure to specify your account credentials using your own storage account and access key:

trans-unit.source: Test that your blob is available via the CDN-specific URL.
trans-unit.target: Test that your blob is available via the CDN-specific URL.

trans-unit.source: For the blob shown above, the URL would be similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: For the blob shown above, the URL would be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: If desired, you can use a tool like **wget** or Fiddler to examine the details of the request and response.
trans-unit.target: If desired, you can use a tool like **wget** or Fiddler to examine the details of the request and response.
